results.title: Foolish wives (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures and Erich Von Stroheim
results.brief_description: Von Stroheim wrote, directed and stars in this enormously expensive and lavish story of decadence and corruption in Monte Carlo after the Great War. Co-starring Maude George and Mae Busch.

results.title: Foods: fads and facts
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of pesticides, preservatives and additives on foods and illustrates how government authorities maintain adequate safety levels on foods through constant supervision of food marketing. Also considers whether organic foods have any more nutritional value than foods grown with help of scientific knowledge. Suitable for secondary level.

Also considers whether organic foods have any more nutritional value than foods grown with help of scientific knowledge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Foods and fun: a nutrition adventure
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Rick Reinert
results.brief_description: Animated film explaining the basics of good health: rest, exercise and a balanced diet. Stresses the need to start the day with a good breakfast. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Food: the story of a peanut butter sandwich
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, International Cinemedia Center and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: At a children’s party a contest is held to see who can make the most interesting sandwich. The popularity of peanut butter leads to an inquiry into food processing, its mechanics and economics. The filmmaker poses questions to the children about the origin of food, especially peanut butter, filling in the historical, geographic, cultural and other factors.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Learning Corporation of America, International Cinemedia Center and George Kaczender

results.title: Food that builds good health
results.brief_description: A young boy called Art is not eating a balanced diet, so is weak and lethargic. A school demonstration with two guinea pigs on different diets convinces Art that he should change his eating habits.

results.title: Food safety guidelines for community food events
results.brief_description: This video is designed to instruct people involved in producing food for community events such as fetes, festivals and food fairs, in its safe preparation, storage and cooking. It provides advice on ways to prevent contamination of food and is accompanied by pads of mini-posters (for distribution), reminding people of the basics of food safety. Kit contains a video cassette and two booklets.

results.title: Food preservation
results.creator_credit: Cammell Hudson, Unilever Films and Hugh Hudson
results.brief_description: Discusses modern developments in food preservation, including quick-freezing and canning. Also shows by animation and microphotography the growth and decay of cells, and the effect of bacterial action in the cell breakdown.

results.title: Food of Southeast Asia
results.brief_description: Follows the activities of the children of three families to show how fish, rice and vegetables - the main foods of Southeast Asia - are produced. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
